content:
• Wednesday, September 3, 2014
  • MITK

    Mitek now +36.3% AH on USAA settlement news

    • Mitek (NASDAQ:MITK) has blasted off following news of its settlement with the USAA.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:51 PM | 2 Comments
  • IO

    Ion Geophysical +2.6% AH thanks to Teledyne/Bolt

    • Ion Geophysical (NYSE:IO) is getting a lift from news Teledyne is acquiring fellow marine/seismic exploration product vendor Bolt Technology for $171M.
    • With a current market cap of $541M, Ion would be a bigger fish to digest.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:31 PM

  • After Hour Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: TIBX +7.9%. BV-OLD +5.3%. PVH +5.1%. IO +3.5%. MHGC +3.1%.
    • Top losers, as of 5:15 p.m.: MTRX -15.9%. SCVL -7.9%. AVAV -5.9%. SONC -3.8%. YUM -3.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM
  • AVAV

    AeroVironment -5.9% AH; gross margin drop pressures EPS

    • AeroVironment (NASDAQ:AVAV) is reiterating guidance for FY15 (ends April '15) revenue of $250M-$270M; consensus is at $258.3M. Gross margin guidance of 34.5%-37.5% is also affirmed.
    • In spite of 18% Y/Y revenue growth, gross margin fell 110 bps in FQ1 to 27.2%, pressuring EPS. AeroVironment says a contract termination cost settlement and higher service contract costs took a toll.
    • Funded backlog totaled $82M at the end of FQ1, up from $65.9M at the end of FQ4 and $76.9M a year ago.
    • FQ1 UAV division sales +17% Y/Y to $41.2M; EV charging system division sales +20% to $10.7M. GAAP SG&A spend +7% Y/Y to $13.4M; R&D spend -1% to $7.1M.
    • FQ1 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 5:20 PM
  • BV-OLD

    Bazaarvoice +3.3% AH on FQ1 beat, strong client adds

    • Bazaarvoice's (NASDAQ:BV-OLD) active clients rose by 66 Q/Q in FQ1 to 1,197, while network clients (no recurring revenue) rose by ~300 to 1.8K+. Annualized SaaS revenue per active client fell by $4K to $152K.
    • Total clients rose 75% Y/Y, and new clients adds rose by 70K. CEO Gene Austin suggests new product launches helped fuel the growth.
    • Not counting PowerReviews, gross margin fell 570 bps Y/Y to 64.3%. GAAP R&D spend +9% to $9.7M, G&A -8% to $7.9M, sales/marketing roughly flat at $21M.
    • FQ1 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 4:47 PM
  • MEMP

    Memorial Production Partners in 13M-unit public offering

    • Memorial Production Partners (NASDAQ:MEMP) -2.9% AH after announcing a public offering of 13M common units, plus a 30-day underwriters option for the purchase of up to an additional 1.95M common units.
    • MEMP says it intends to use the proceeds to repay a portion of the outstanding borrowings under its revolving credit facility.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:43 PM
  • TDY

    Teledyne buying Bolt Technology for $171M

    • Teledyne (NYSE:TDY) is paying $22/share in cash to acquire BOLT Technology. The price represents a 37% premium to Bolt's Wednesday close.
    • Teledyne asserts Bolt's marine instrumentation products will complement its existing marine offerings - Teledyne's hydrophone arrays, for example, can listen for echoes from Bolt's acoustic sources.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • TIBX

    Tibco +6% AH; strategic review officially launched

    • Tibco's (NASDAQ:TIBX) board has approved "a review of a variety of strategic and financial alternatives available to the Company through the formation of a Special Committee of independent directors."
    • The WSJ reported in August the middleware/analytics software vendor is reaching out to potential buyers. Activist Praesidium Investment has suggested Tibco should put itself on the block.
    • Separately, Tibco has announced its FQ3 report will arrive on Sep. 18.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM | 4 Comments
  • CLNY

    NorthStar Realty with 45M share secondary

    • At least half of the offering is subject to a forward sale agreement. The underwriter greenshoe should be 6.75M shares.
    • NRF -2.3% AH
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM | 2 Comments
  • PVH

    Phillips-Van Heusen beats by $0.09, misses on revenue

    • Phillips-Van Heusen (NYSE:PVH): Q2 EPS of $1.51 beats by $0.09.
    • Revenue of $1.98B (+1.0% Y/Y) misses by $10M.
    • Shares +2.73% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM
  • CPE

    Callon Petroleum keeps rising after Midland Basin acquisition

    • Callon Petroleum (CPE +3.4%) enjoys a round of analyst price target hikes in the wake of its acquisition of Midland Basin core acreage, which helps alleviate some investor concerns about future horizontal drilling inventory and increases gross producing zone locations by ~50%.
    • Among three price target increases, Howard Weil raises its CPE target to an apparent Street-high $20 from $17; CPE already had been one of the firm's favorite pure-play Permian names, and the deal further supports its view that CPE is one of the best small-cap ways to play the Midland Basin; CPE now controls a robust horizontal drilling inventory life of 11 years using four rigs conservatively targeting just the already producing zones and as many as ~21 years assuming all zones (Briefing.com).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • NEON

    Neonode gains following new insider buy

    • Neonode (NEON +3.8%) director Mats Dahlin discloses he bought 20K shares yesterday at $3.00.
    • Dahlin previously bought 40K shares in August at $3.08, and 50K in May at $3.77. CEO Thomas Eriksson has bought 135K shares this year via 3 purchases.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM
  • DRYS

    DryShips pulls order for four newbuildings

    • DryShips (DRYS -1.5%) says it canceled newbuilding contracts for four ice-class panamax bulker vessels under construction at debt-ridden Rongsheng Heavy Industries.
    • DRYS had paid $11.5M for the vessels but got that money back plus interest in the cancellation; it had paid ~$124M before the decision to cancel the deal.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM | 2 Comments
  • CENX

    Century Aluminum +11% this week on positive analyst commentary

    • Century Aluminum (CENX +2.5%) caps a two-day ~11% surge after Deutsche Bank initiates coverage with a Buy rating and $30 price target, anticipating a sharp earnings recovery based on a combination of higher pricing, volume growth, product mix shift and declining unit costs.
    • The firm points to CENX's Ravenswood and Helguvik projects, which could represent another $2 and $5 per share respectively, and notes that the company has increasing free cash flows which could be used for accretive acquisitions.
    • Morgan Stanley upgraded CENX yesterday to Overweight from Equal Weight with a $33 target, with expectations for continually rising aluminum prices and strong demand.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 PM
  • DCTH

    Delcath shares ease in the wake of call to sell the company

    • Shares of thinly-traded nano cap Delcath Systems (OTC:DCTH -3.5%) ease up today on increased volume. Shares rose 7% yesterday after activist shareholder Linkedto Partners called for management to cut their hefty salaries in order to save money and pursue an immediate sale of the firm considering its substantial cash burn and scant revenues.
    • Whether or not management listens to Linedto Partners is unknown. Its position is only 77K shares which represents a modest 0.8% stake.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM | 10 Comments
  • MBII

    Marrone Bio getting roughed up after report on restatement of financials

    • Investors smack Marrone Bio Innovations (MBII -40.7%) down on a 10x surge in volume after it reported that its recent financial statements can no longer be relied upon to be GAAP compliant and a chunk of revenue that was recognized in Q4 2013 may not be valid.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM
  • CBLI

    Cleveland Bio up big after report of positive FDA opinion on entolimod

    • Shares of thinly-traded nano cap Cleveland BioLabs (CBLI +49.3%) jump on a massive 23x surge in volume after the company reported that its existing safety and efficacy data and animal-to-human dose conversion are sufficient to proceed with a pre-Emergency Use Authorization submission to the FDA for the use of entolimod to reduce the risk of death following radiation exposure.
    • The company's opinion is based on the minutes from its July meeting with the agency. Regulatory approval will allow the use of entolimod in the event of a radiological or nuclear emergency.
    • In a study involving 179 non-human primates, a single IM injection of entolimod given 25 hours after whole-body irradiation increased survival from 27.5% to 75%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:15 PM

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Top 10 Gainers: INFI +46%. ISNS +39%. VII +38%. BTH +30%. MAGS +32%. BYFC +22%. ALTI +21%. VGGL +14%. SHIP +14%. ITI +14%.
    • Top 10 Losers: MBII -39%. IRMD -38%. WTSL -21%. DGLY -18%. RPRX -15%. ARGS -13%. VNCE -11%. OTC:ASTI -11%. HELE -10%. COUP -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM
  • X

    Bears confounded as U.S. Steel keeps rising

    • U.S. Steel (X +2.7%) remains solidly higher on the day after Morgan Stanley named it a top pick, and is now up by a third YTD; most steel peers also are higher, with MT +2.7%, STLD +2.5%, NUE +2.2%, CMC +2.2%, but AKS -4.8% after guiding Q3 earnings below consensus.
    • Axiom Capital’s Gordon Johnson admits he’s been wrong on U.S. Steel this year, but he stands by his bearish call, noting that what really got the stock going was guidance for Q3 pointing to ~$1/share in GAAP EPS.
    • Johnson thinks the optimism is not realistic and sees 10%-15% downside to U.S. HRC spot prices as likely before year-end 2014 and noting the inherent volatility in the company's earnings to shifts in U.S. HRC spot prices, elevated by resiliency in U.S. HRC spot prices (-1.2% YTD), despite the fall in both iron ore (-35% YTD) and coking coal prices (-21% YTD).
     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM | 4 Comments
  • RPRX

    Repros under selling pressure as key Ad Comm meeting approaches

    • Shares of micro cap Repros Therapeutics (RPRX -14.6%) drop on a 4x surge in volume. Investors appear anxious over the upcoming September 17 joint meeting of the FDA's Bone, Reproductive and Urologic Drugs Advisory Committee and the Drug Safety and Risk Management Advisory Committee.
    • Two controversial issues regarding testosterone replacement therapy (TRT) are on the agenda: the appropriate patient population for whom TRT should be indicated and the potential risk of major adverse cardiovascular events associated with TRT use.
    • Repros' lead product is Androxal, an oral testosterone replacement therapy for secondary hypogonadism.
    • RPRX rallied last week in response to successful Phase 3 results for Androxal compared to AbbVie's (ABBV -0.1%) Androgel.
    • Briefing docs
     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM | 3 Comments
  • CRUS

    Apple suppliers follow Apple lower

    • Apple suppliers Cirrus Logic (CRUS -3%), GT Advanced (GTAT -5%), Skyworks (SWKS -2.3%), TriQuint (TQNT -2.6%), and RF Micro (RFMD -2.8%) are following Apple lower after Pac Crest recommended investors start taking profits on the tech giant ahead of its Sep. 9 event. Expected iPhone 6 motion sensor supplier InvenSense (INVN -3.3%) is also off.
    • GT was hit recently by two downgrades, partly offset by a bullish coverage launch. InvenSense, Skyworks, TriQuint, and RF Micro have all rallied strongly over the last 3 months.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:16 PM | 16 Comments
  • IRMD

    Investors take exception to iRadimed's handling of warning letter

    • Shares of recent IPO iRadimed (IRMD -37.9%) get pounded as investors realize the significance of the warning letter it received from the FDA and management's delay in realizing what it had.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM
  • CPLP

    Capital Product Partners -6.5% on news of 15M-unit offering

    • Capital Product Partners (CPLP -6.5%) is sharply lower after pricing a public offering of 15M common units at $10.53/unit; CPLP also is granting the underwriters a 30-day option to purchase an additional 2.25M common units.
    • CPLP says it will use part of the net proceeds to partially fund the purchase of two 5K deadweight product carriers as well as the repurchase of ~$60M worth of common units from Capital Maritime & Trading, and for general corporate purposes.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM | 1 Comment
  • ATHL

    Athlon Energy reiterated Buy at Topeka Capital after strong well results

    • Athlon Energy (ATHL +3.2%) reported the best horizontal well in the eastern Midland Basin with its latest well in Howard County as part of its operational update late yesterday, Topeka Capital says, prompting the firm to raise its production trajectory and its target price for Buy-rated ATHL shares to $64 from $60 (Briefing.com).
    • Additionally, ATHL reported a top-tier Wolfcamp B well and an above average initial Lower Spraberry well in the basin.
    • ATHL's eight total horizontal wells are outperforming their type curves by nearly 70% with the wells tracking more than 90% rate of returns on average at $90/bbl oil, which Topeka says is above its type curve average of 36%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • YNDX

    Russian tech/telecom stocks rally on cease-fire hopes

    • Russian tech/telecom names are higher Vladimir Putin declared a Ukraine cease-fire could be reached this week, and that his views on ending the fighting are "very close" to those of Ukranian President Petro Poroshenko.
    • Gainers: YNDX +4.2%. QIWI +2.2%. MBT +3.4%. VIP +2.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM
  • LOCM

    Local.com higher following settlement with Fry's

    • Local.com (LOCM +4.2%) says it has obtained "a favorable settlement" with Fry's Electronics for its patent suit against the retailer. Local.com sued Fry's in 2012 for allegedly infringing an e-commerce-related patent (USPTO filing).
    • The company claims to have "identified hundreds of websites and applications that we believe infringe upon this patent and believe there are likely thousands more." A recent Supreme Court ruling could get in the way.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM
  • SC

    Santander Consumer behaving well after P-E owners unload

    • Sponsor Auto Finance Holdings (comprised of shops like KKR and Warburg Pincus) sold 10.05M shares in a public offering at a price of $18.68 each.
    • Santander Consumer (NYSE:SC) is currently lower by 2.2% to $18.93.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM
  • BRG

    Bluerock Residential on the move as SA author sees big value

    • Struggling a little bit out of the gates after its IPO five months ago, Bluerock Residential (BRG +4.2%) has its tail in the air today after SA Pro's Dane Bowler suggests investor misconceptions have left the stock trading at a significant discount to peers as well as to NAV.
    • The stock debuted in late March at $14.50 (vs. an expected $15) and, before today's big gain, had slipped to about $13. Bowler sees fair value of $18.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM | 1 Comment
  • MBLY

    Mobileye soars; Morgan Stanley makes $100/share bull case

    • Though keeping a $46 target for now, Morgan Stanley's Ravi Shanker thinks Mobileye (MBLY +9.8%) could be worth $100/share in a bull-case scenario.
    • Shanker argues $20 of upside could be provided to his target if Mobileye maintains a near-80% share of driver-assistance systems, rather than seeing its share gradually drop to ~50%. Another $12 of upside is deemed possible if Mobileye holds onto a ~75% gross margin, and $10 of upside if the company maintains current pricing.
    • Shanker: "As the only pure-play on two of the fastest growing trends in the auto industry – autonomous cars and software – we forecast MBLY could achieve 50%+ revenue CAGR, 60%+ margins, ~100% FCF conversion...and these may even be conservative estimates."
    • Worth noting: At $100/share, Mobileye would be worth $21.2B, or 96x 2015E sales.
    • Previous: Mobileye pops after underwriters launch coverage
     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM | 2 Comments
  • CXUSF

    Canexus -11% as it takes MEG pipeline dispute to court

    • Canexus (OTCPK:CXUSF -10.8%) says the crude-by-rail unit train loading expansion at its North American Terminal Operations is ready for commissioning and start-up, but MEG Energy (OTCPK:MEGEF) has refused to allow it to perform work required to tie-in the Cold Lake pipeline system.
    • Canexus says it believes MEG has no legal justification for its refusal and says it is taking legal action to enforce all legal rights and remedies to protect its NATO business.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM | 9 Comments
  • SIR

    Select Income REIT falls further after Cole deal

    • Select Income REIT (SIR -1.1%) adds to yesterday's sharp decline as Bank of America downgrades to Underperform following SIR's deal to buy Cole Corporate Income Trust in a deal valued at about $3B.
    • Cole shareholders will receive either $10.50 in cash of 0.36 shares of SIR for each share of Cole they own.
    • The purchase would more than double Select Income's assets and enterprise value, and the company said the result should be a lower cost of capital and boosted shareholder value.
    • Select Income is managed by the Portnoy family's RMR - the same team which was just ousted from CommonWealth REIT (now called Equity Commonwealth, ticker EQC) for maybe being too interested in boosting AUM at the expense of shareholder value.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • AAPL

    Apple drops after Pac Crest recommends taking profits

    • Six months after upgrading Apple (AAPL -3%) to Outperform on iPhone 6 hopes, Pac Crest's Andy Hargreaves recommends investors start taking profits.
    • Though keeping his rating for now, Hargreaves says a downgrade could arrive if Apple's Sep. 9 event doesn't reveal products/services that "suggest massive incremental profit opportunities." He doubts Apple's rumored wearable and payments platform will "drive incremental profits that are meaningful at Apple's scale in the near to medium term," and is hoping some "clarifying detail" will be given at the event.
    • Other Apple-related news: 1) A Chinese site indicates China Mobile has already begun taking iPhone 6 reservations. 2) Apple is reportedly talking with Nordstrom about supporting its payments platform. 3) The fallout from a weekend iCloud celebrity photo-theft scandal continues. Apple, for its part, denies iCloud was breached, but doesn't deny photos were taken through the service. 4) Ahead of the iPhone 6 launch, Samsung has unveiled its Note 4 and Edge phablets; the latter features a display that curves at the edges.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM | 88 Comments
  • TAT

    TransAtlantic Petroleum to acquire Stream Oil & Gas for $41M

    • TransAtlantic Petroleum (TAT -2%) agrees to acquire Stream Oil & Gas for $41.2M in TAT shares.
    • Stream owns 100% interests in three oil fields, one gas field and one exploration license in Albania, which encompass ~75K net acres.
    • TAT says the deal provides geologic and geographic diversification, with exploitation potential similar to its Selmo field in Turkey, with a large volume of known oil in place.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM
  • HOV

    Homebuilders slip after Toll Bros. results

    • The homebuilders are lower in early action following Toll Brothers beating earnings estimates, but expressing caution on pricing power, and cutting guidance for full-year home deliveries.
    • ITB -0.8%, XHB -0.5%.
    • Individual names: Hovnanian (HOV -0.9%), Lennar (LEN -1.5%), KB Home (KBH -1.8%), PulteGroup (PHM -1.4%), D.R. Horton (DHI -1.1%), Ryland (RYL -1.5%), NVR (NVR -1.1%), Standard Pacific (SPF -1.1%).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM | 1 Comment
  • EXAS

    Exact Sciences continues bull run

    • Exact Sciences (EXAS +7.3%) is up again in early trading. Shares have more than doubled from the May 8, 2014 low of $10.69. The FDA approved its DNA-based colorectal cancer screening test on August 11, 2014.
    • The company's market cap is approaching $2B.
    • 267 mutual funds have positions, up from 213 a year ago.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:10 AM | 2 Comments
  • TOL

    Caution on pricing stings Toll Bros. after earnings beat

    • "We have seen some lessening of pricing power in the past year," says Toll Brothers (TOL -2.6%) chief Douglas Yearley, quickly adding the company does not yet see the need to boost incentives to spur sales.
    • Fiscal 2014 guidance: Deliveries now expected at 5.3K-5.5K homes from 5.1K-5.85K previously (midpoint drops to 5.4K from 5.475K); ASP of deliveries of $710K-$725K from $690-$720K.
    • Gross margin is expected to be 185-200 bps higher than 2013 vs. previous guidance of 175-200 bps improvement.
    • Expected selling communities is now at 255-275 vs. 250-290 previously.
    • Previously: Toll Brothers beats by $0.08, beats on revenue
     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM
  • CPG

    Crescent Point in C$378M deal for Lightstream assets

    • Crescent Point Energy (CPG -2.9%) agrees to acquire producing conventional oil assets in Saskatchewan and Manitoba, along with undeveloped land, from Lightstream Resources for C$378M ($346M).
    • CPG says the assets produce ~3,300 boe/day, and come with 76 net sections of land adjacent to its existing land base in the area.
    • CPG also raises its 2014 forecast, based on the Lightstream deal and other acquisitions made YTD, along with successful drilling results at its Torquay resource play in Saskatchewan.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM | 10 Comments
  • UCFC

    United Community Financial boosted by positive coverage

    • Ohio and Western Pennsylvania's United Community Financial (UCFC +1.3%) continues a nice run after Boenning Scattergood joins in, initiating coverage with an Outperform rating and $6 price target.
    • The stock's ahead nearly 50% over the last four months.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM
  • NE

    Fir Tree discloses talks with Noble Corp. about MLP, other alternatives

    • Fir Tree Value discloses a 9.6% active stake in Noble Corp. (NE +2.1%) and says it had a "productive meeting" with NE director Gordon Hall on Aug. 29 concerning the company's capital allocation policies.
    • Fir Tree says it acknowledged management’s recent excellent operational record but discussed NE’s dividend policy, share buybacks, board composition and compensation, and other strategic alternatives, including the formation of an MLP.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM
  • X

    U.S. Steel strong before the open as Morgan Stanley raises outlook

    • U.S. Steel (NYSE:X) +2.7% premarket as Morgan Stanley upgrades its view on the steel sector to Attractive while raising its price target for X, the firm's top pick in the sector, to $60 from $35 with a bull case for $87.
    • Stanley sees the steel industry benefiting from both structural and cyclical improvements, and likes U.S. Steel's compelling company-specific cost-cutting initiative; the firm also thinks X is getting ready to walk away from its loss-making Canadian operations.
    • Shares also may be getting a lift because of its exposure to favorable headlines out of eastern Europe: US Steel Europe, representing 17% of overall revenue, includes a steel plant and coke production facilities in Slovakia.
    • ArcelorMittal (NYSE:MT), with a strong presence in the area, also +2.7%; the other U.S. steel producers - AKS, CMC, NUE, STLD - have less exposure to the region and are little changed premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:13 AM

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: ISNS +37%. INFI +35%. VII +25%. MAGS +21%. LRAD +13%. ITI +14%. LOCM +12%. CNQR +9%. ACH +8%. IDN +8%. HALO +6%. EFUT +6%. HPJ +6%. ZTS +5%.
    • Losers: DGLY -10%. CPLP -6%. GWRE -5%. VNCE -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:11 AM
  • HPJ

    Highpower begins advanced battery shipments for Acer's new tablet

    • Highpower (NASDAQ:HPJ) has started shipping its 4600 mAh lithium batteries developed specifically for Acer's (OTC:ACEIY) new Iconia Tab 8.
    • The batteries allow for the tablet to offer many high-end features including 7.5 hours of continuous video watch time.
    • HPJ +7.1% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 9:08 AM | 1 Comment
  • INFI

    Infinity Pharma set for gap up at the open

    • Shares of Infinity Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:INFI) are up 40% premarket on robust volume in response to its collaboration with AbbVie (NYSE:ABBV) to develop and commercialize duvelisib. ABBV is up a fraction premarket on turnover of only 200 shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:41 AM | 1 Comment
  • BDBD

    Boulder Brands on the move after upgrade

    • Shares of Boulder Brands (BDBD +2.6%) are higher in early trading after Longbow Research chimes in with an upgrade on the stock to a Buy rating.
    • Analysts with the firm think Boulder Brands has an advantage in the gluten-free and non-GMO categories that could help drive growth.
    • BDBD +1.7% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 8:19 AM

  • Futures higher following Ukraine cease-fire agreement/steps

    • While the Ukraine president's office says Porshenko and Putin agreed to a cease-fire in eastern Ukraine, a Kremlin spokesman says the two only discussed steps to facilitate a cease-fire. "Russia can't negotiate a cease-fire because it isn't a party to the conflict" ... and so it goes.
    • Major U.S. stock index futures are all ahead about 0.45%, and Europe's Stoxx 50 (NYSEARCA:FEZ) is up 1.3%. The Hang Seng's 2.3% gain led Asia higher overnight.
    • The 10-year Treasury yield is up three basis points to 2.45% and gold is up $3 per ounce to $1,268.
    • ETFs: SPY, QQQ, SH, DIA, SSO, SDS, VOO, PSQ, IVV, SPXU, UPRO, TQQQ, SPXL, RSP, QID, SQQQ, DOG, QLD, DXD, RWL, EPS, UDOW, SDOW, DDM, BXUB, QQEW, QQQE, SPLX, SFLA, BXUC, QQXT, SPUU
     
     
     
     
    | 7:05 AM | 2 Comments

  • Russian shares take off following ceasefire agreement

    • Russian stocks are soaring following President Poroshenko's and Vladimir Putin's permanent ceasefire agreement in the Donbass region of eastern Ukraine.
    • The dollar-denominated RTS index is up 4.4% at 1229.58, while its ruble-based peer MICEX is 2.8% higher at 1,439.58.
    • ETFs: RSX, RUSL, RSXJ, RUSS, ERUS, RBL, RUDR
     
     
     
     
    | 4:51 AM | 1 Comment
